text: Ptychoptera albimana is a species of fly in the family Ptychopteridae. It can be found throughout the PalearcticBei-Bienko, G.Y. & Steyskal, G.C. (1988) Keys to the Insects of the European Part of the USSR, Volume V: Diptera and Siphonaptera, Parts I, II. Amerind Publishing Co., New Delhi. R. L. Coe, Paul Freeman & P. F. Mattingly, 1950 Handbooks for the identification of British insects Vol 9 Part 2 ii. Diptera - 2. Nematocera: families Tipulidae to Chironomidae (Trichoceridae - Culicidae). Royal Entomological Society, London pdf but commonly found throughout Britain. == Description == The body of Ptychoptera albimana is mostly black with distinct orange marking, usually on the dorsal section. The insect is most active between spring and fall, with the female laying 500 eggs. ==References== Category:Ptychopteridae Category:Insects described in 1787 Category:Nematoceran flies of Europe
title: Ptychoptera albimana
